CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and he comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of he city, a veritable goodwill ambassador...2. He sends the Y.M.C.A. Emblem club and guests into gales of laughter with his funny stories.  In picture 1) Bill being given the key to the city by Major Scully."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor Cornelius D. Scully presenting box and shaking hands with Bill "Bojangles" Robinson, with another man looking on, in the Office of the Mayor at the City County Building, another version
CatSubject_tab: Mayors--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Scully, Cornelius D., 1878-1952.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Chairs--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Robinson, Bill, 1878-1949.City-County Building (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Offices--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
